Actions.ActionName: Determine if title field is focused and cancel if necessary
Execute AppleScript to determine if title field is focused
Actions.Path: %Variable%DND_syncPath%/Programming/AppleScript/Keyboard Maestro/Determine if macro title field is focused.scpt
Actions.Text: ----------------------------------------------------------# Author:				Chris Thomerson## Current Version:		1.0# Version History:			1.1 (Cleaned up AppleScript and removed superfluous lines)#						1.0 (Initial script)## Created:				Saturday, November 27, 2021# Modified:				Saturday, December 25, 2021# macOS:				11.6.2 (Big Sur), 12.1 (Monterey)## DISCLAIMER# Permission to use, copy, modify, and/or distribute this# software for any purpose with or without fee is hereby granted.## THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THE AUTHOR DISCLAIMS ALL# WARRANTIES WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED# WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL# THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR# CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM# LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT,# NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN# CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.----------------------------------------------------------tell application "System Events"	tell application process "Keyboard Maestro" to tell (first window whose subrole is "AXStandardWindow" and title contains "Keyboard Maestro Editor") to tell group 6 to tell splitter group 1 to tell scroll area 3				tell (first text field whose role is "AXTextField" and description is "Macro Name")						if value of attribute "AXFocused" is true then				set fieldFocused to "true"			else				set fieldFocused to "false"			end if					end tell			end tellend tellfieldFocused

Actions.ActionName: Cancel macro if in the title field
Only run if Groups column is selected (using menu path)
